Title: A machine and human reader study on AI diagnosis model safety under attacks of adversarial images
Summary: While active efforts are advancing medical AI model development and clinical translation, safety issues of medical AI models have emerged. Here, the authors investigate the effects on an AI model and on human experts of potential fake/adversarial images for breast cancer diagnosis.

Title: The power of genetic diversity in genome-wide association studies of lipids
Summary: A genome-wide association meta-analysis study of blood lipid levels in roughly 1.6 million individuals demonstrates the gain of power attained when diverse ancestries are included to improve fine-mapping and polygenic score generation, with gains in locus discovery related to sample size.

Title: Serological responses and vaccine effectiveness for extended COVID-19 vaccine schedules in England
Summary: The UK extended the interval until the second COVID-19 vaccine dose up to 12 weeks. Here, the authors show in a cohort of 750 participants aged 50–89 years that the extended schedule results in higher antibody titers and estimate a higher vaccine effectiveness for the extended schedule.

The C-shaped root canal systems in mandibular second molars in an Emirati population
Satisfied quantitative value can be acquired by short-time bone SPECT/CT using a whole-body cadmium–zinc–telluride gamma camera
Diet and lifestyle behaviour disruption related to the pandemic was varied and bidirectional among US and UK adults participating in the ZOE COVID Study
Summary: Big data collected through apps can facilitate large-scale study of diet and lifestyles. Information from the ZOE COVID Study indicates the variety and extent of impacts that the COVID-19 pandemic has had on the diets and lifestyles of adults in the United States and the United Kingdom.

Title: Underdiagnosis bias of artificial intelligence algorithms applied to chest radiographs in under-served patient populations
Summary: Artificial intelligence algorithms trained using chest X-rays consistently underdiagnose pulmonary abnormalities or diseases in historically under-served patient populations, raising ethical concerns about the clinical use of such algorithms.
